title: 2015 Countdown Problem #15: Palindrome Integration
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/830a6063be.3be84a966c.3bGQYN.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a real number and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a real-valued function on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the next palindrome larger than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a palindrome); or"}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a palindrome)."}]}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For example, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1001)=1001"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1001.01)=f(1002)=1111"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A=\int _{ 999 }^{ 2015 }{ f(x) \mbox{ } dx } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B=f(...(f(f(1603)-58)-58)...)-58"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{A}{B}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1603)=1661. 1661- 58 =1603. So we get back to where we were. Iterating any number of times will get us back to 1603. So B=1603. Now for  999<x<=1001 we have f(x)= 1001.  1001<x<=1111 f(x)= 1111. Continuing in this fashion gives us f(x)=     2(1001) + 110 ( 1111+1221+ .... + 1991) + 11(2002) +13(2112) = 1586970 = A."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So A/B = 990"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #16: Some Brute Force & Luck Needed – Part I
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/830a6063be.c31e014403.4dH8px.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
A sequence is defined by the recurrence relation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_1=2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" equals the sum of the squares of each digit in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_{(n-1)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n≥2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many more square numbers than prime numbers are there between "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" inclusive?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"#GoodLuckHaveFun","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            You have assumed by finding a pattern that the loop continues till 2015. Is there any much better solid proof ?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2015 Countdown Problem #17: A Graph Theory Problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/solvable/830a6063be.ce6b7081d4.lTTPyi.gif"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Suppose there are 2015 vertices. Let a complete graph on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" vertices be denoted as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Which statements are true?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I. "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has 2029105 edges."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"II. Suppose two "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" graphs are connected together, by having exactly one edge connected between any vertex in each of the original "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" graphs, to form a new graph "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"G_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"G_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is bipartite."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"III. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H_{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be a complete 2014-partite graph on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" vertices, such that the number of vertices in each partition are equal. Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"K_{2015}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a subgraph of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H_{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is part of the set 2015 Countdown Problems.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}
